NARRATOR: (SYNC) Do your students
need to sharpen their writing skills? How
about letters to Congressmen, pushing for
effective legislation?
HE PUTS THE MAGNET STRIP
ON THE BOARD, JUST UNDER
“INTERVIEWS”
Or a request for government publications
from which abstracts could be prepared
for the rest of the class?
NARRATOR PICKS UP AND PRE¬
SENTS TO THE CAMERA A MAG¬
NETIC STRIP READING “OB¬
SERVATION”
Maybe one of the school maintenance men
would show a group from your class the
filth collected on the air filters.
HE PICKS UP AND PRESENTS
ANOTHER MAGNETIC STRIP
READING “EXPERIMENTATION”
Or some of your "do-it-myself-ers" might
want to see what happens in a Petri dish. .
when they put it out in the room for a while
then put the lid on.
44. MS. NARRATOR AT MAGNET
BOARD. HE PUTS ON THE
BOARD-JUST UNDER “WRITING"-
THE STRIPS READING "OBSERVATION”
AND "EXPERIMENTATION”
NARRATOR: (SYNC)
Well. . .there, now!
THEN STEPS BACK TO LOOK AT
THE WHOLE LIST.
That's a pretty respectable list of things,
isn't it?
